channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [LOG4J2-1852] Plugins lookup by package is not compatible with Spring Boot jar packaging
item.description:
Here is you can find a description of the issue and pretty usefull answer from Spring Boot team regarding the very same issue:
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/8637
Also you will find a sample project there that will help to reproduce issue.
item.summary: Plugins lookup by package is not compatible with Spring Boot jar packaging

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Is there any update or on this issue? As stated by the Spring Boot team using the JARURLConnection route could eliminate the need to modify the URL done by the ResolverUtil. A possible approach with limited modifications could be to overload the loadImplementationsInJar method to allow for a JarFile and do the needed matching tests. This should handle common packaging structures of jars/wars along with the nested approach for Spring Boot's packaging.

private void loadImplementationsInJar(ResolverUtil.Test test, String parent, JarFile jarFile) {

        final Enumeration<JarEntry> entries = jarFile.entries();

        while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
            JarEntry entry = entries.nextElement();
            String name = entry.getName();

            if (!entry.isDirectory() && name.startsWith(parent) && this.isTestApplicable(test, name)) {
                this.addIfMatching(test, name);
            }
        }
 }

Are you able to provide a patch?

Gary

Let's not forget that the simplest solution is generate a jar with a Log4j2Plugins.dat, which is the way Log4j is designed to work by default.

Gary

Hi garydgregory, unfortunately, I am not in a position right now to prepare a patch. I will keep in mind this issue and try to review it once more. Would you be able to share a link with FAQ regarding contribution rules/advices?

I can work on submitting a patch this week. garydgregory the Log4j2Plugins.dat file was included in the executable Jar and was discovered by ResolverUtil, unfortunately when discovery happens the URI is rewritten. On initial discovery it is found under <PARENT JAR Path>!/BOOT-INF/lib/<JAR CONTAINING Log4j2Plugins.dat>, then modified to <PARENT JAR PATH>. To by pass this you can generate a flattened uber jar with the shade plugin, but tolerance to handle Spring Boot's packaging seems like an easier approach will utilizing the framework.

GitHub user ta924 opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/pull/93

modification to resolver to discover jar assests without the manipula…

…tion of asset paths.

This PR is to address issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LOG4J2-1852. If the resource submitted for scanning is of Jar protocol it utilizes a JarURLConnection to scan for classes matching the test, it will no longer manipulate the URI for Jars. In the event the protocol is file it will proceed with the existing approach.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/ta924/logging-log4j2 PATCH-LOG4J2-1852

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/pull/93.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #93

commit f7fdc3a3edae62f936233935968bfa0cdd0486e0
Author: Tanner Altares <tanner.altares@walmart.com>
Date: 2017-07-17T14:01:04Z

modification to resolver to discover jar assests without the manipulation of asset paths.
PR https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/pull/93 has been submitted as a possible option to address this ticket.

I wanted to come back here and clarify a comment that I previously made around the Log4j2Plugins.dat being present in the package. I was incorrect the Log4j2Plugins.dat wasn't being excluded due to the fact that the jar was being shaded and relocating the paths. The implementation used is creating a custom configuration and adding packages directly view addPackages on the PluginManager. When ran with Spring Boot's packaging the PluginManager isn't able to discover from the collectPlugins method. For this situation it is more of an isolated case, but the PR should suffice for normal operations along with this scenario. I will add additional tests to the PR and submit for review.

Just an update to point out that the original reporter of this issue found a workaround as noted in https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/8637.

That said, it should be a high priority to be as compatible with Spring as possible.
Hi ralph.goers@dslextreme.com, it seems this issue is not reproducible with latest spring boot and log4j2. I will double check it tomorrow and let you know.
Any further feedback?

Sorry for delay. I have just verified with following dependencies:

  • Spring Boot 1.5.20 / Log4j-core 2.7 -> doesn't work
  • Spring Boot 2.1.4 / Log4j-core 2.11.2 -> doesn't work

So it seems issue is still actual, so I have updated sample app to reproduce issue to latest spring boot 2.1.4.

OK. So to summarize my understanding, this issue occurs only when the plugin does not exist in a Log4j2Plugins.dat file and is in a jar packaged inside another jar, war, ear, etc that is not exploded. I can think of a few solutions:

  1. Apply the provided patch. This requires scanning at runtime which is sub-optimal (due to the performance hit) but will always work.
  2. Provide a tool that can create the Log4j2Plugins.dat file as a separate step in a build after compilation has completed but before the archive is constructed.
  3. Provide some kind of tool that can create a Log4j2Plugins.dat file for all the plugins contained in all the jars being packaged together at build time. This seems like it could be pretty involved.

Option 1 seems like it should be done since it is not mutually exclusive with the other options. Option 2 seems like a good idea as there are people who don't seem to want to run an annotation processor.

FWIW - LOG4J2-2621 was implemented in 3.0 to have the plugin location mechanism use java.util.ServiceLoader to locate a class containing the plugin definitions. This class can be automatically generated by the annotation processor or manually created.

Commit 9abf2a91a4f7625f154c2e853a5747d777241a55 in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/release-2.x from Ralph Goers
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=9abf2a9 ]

LOG4J2-1852 - Locate plugins inside a Jar using a URLConnection
I tested the fix in the commit noted above against https://github.com/mnovoseltsev/log4j2-springboot-plugins-issue and verified that it fixed the issue.
